text:
The NFL season kicked off Thursday at Sports Authority Field, home of the Denver Broncos. The stadium is just one of 36 that have received a total of $3.2 billion in tax breaks since 2000.
That's according to a new study from the Brookings Institution, which looked at 45 stadiums in the four major sports leagues that have been built or renovated in that time.
The stadiums were financed in part with municipal bonds, which are issued by local governments. Interest on those bonds is exempt from federal taxes.
Brookings calculates that the federal government lost $3.2 billion in tax revenue -- and $3.7 billion if you count the windfall that high-income bondholders get.

But, that does NOT mean I will not use, tomorrow.  Get your support network established.  They don't even have to know that they are your support network.  You just need people who you can count on, to be with, when you are feeling the urge. AND, you have to get rid of those who encourage you to use, intentionally, or not.  Let me tell you, it is REALLY hard, kicking your BROTHERS loose.  And it is, almost, as difficult as explaining it to your parents.  Staying sober is EVERYTHING.  Look at what you are, sober, compared to what you are, when you are under the influence.  Which is more likely to put you in the position you want to be in, when it is time to retire?  A relapse is not a failure.  It just means you weren't ready yet, but you are going in the right direction.  Just say "no".
